snippet.textDisplay:
My favorite thing about this game is EVERY dungeon run is a chance to upgrade your character until you are deep into Eternals. 
Even if the loot you get is a item you don't want. You can just scrap it and get the gold from it. And use that to upgrade pieces. Or you can scrap pieces you have upgraded but are now unwanted/replaced. And you get gold and materials back. My god my character constantly feels rewarded for just playing the game. No running X M+ dungeon 70+ times and never getting a weapon or trinket you need. You will get loot. They want you to get loot. They want you to progress to end game dungeons in eternal. It's amazing how good it feels just playing and you don't feel like you wasted your afternoon. Alts are also super easy to gear thanks to unlocking alt gear vendor through playing a main. Once you complete Adept 7 your alts can start farming resources to buy 130 ilvl gear. That's a huge boost to get you going. Blizzard would choke on the idea of making it rewarding and not make you misserable at the same time.
snippet.textOriginal:
My favorite thing about this game is EVERY dungeon run is a chance to upgrade your character until you are deep into Eternals. 
Even if the loot you get is a item you don't want. You can just scrap it and get the gold from it. And use that to upgrade pieces. Or you can scrap pieces you have upgraded but are now unwanted/replaced. And you get gold and materials back. My god my character constantly feels rewarded for just playing the game. No running X M+ dungeon 70+ times and never getting a weapon or trinket you need. You will get loot. They want you to get loot. They want you to progress to end game dungeons in eternal. It's amazing how good it feels just playing and you don't feel like you wasted your afternoon. Alts are also super easy to gear thanks to unlocking alt gear vendor through playing a main. Once you complete Adept 7 your alts can start farming resources to buy 130 ilvl gear. That's a huge boost to get you going. Blizzard would choke on the idea of making it rewarding and not make you misserable at the same time.

snippet.textDisplay:
Sadly, I can't agree that games should be as easy as they are right now. Account-bound should be gone, just like the Warbank in WoW, Shared Achievements, etc. People have become so soft and blame it all on "we don't have the time," which is false. You just don't want to spend it.
Everything nowadays is casual compared to what it should be. Too much holding your hands, giving you free shit, making you level up fast so you can just " Enjoy" Endgame. There is no world-building, no stories, and it's become so on rails that we should be scared..
The years of good MMORPGS are gone, and the Reckoning is at hand.
snippet.textOriginal:
Sadly, I can't agree that games should be as easy as they are right now. Account-bound should be gone, just like the Warbank in WoW, Shared Achievements, etc. People have become so soft and blame it all on "we don't have the time," which is false. You just don't want to spend it.
Everything nowadays is casual compared to what it should be. Too much holding your hands, giving you free shit, making you level up fast so you can just " Enjoy" Endgame. There is no world-building, no stories, and it's become so on rails that we should be scared..
The years of good MMORPGS are gone, and the Reckoning is at hand.

snippet.textDisplay:
Don't... Don't call it a mission table.  You say that and all I see it those damn follower mission tables from Wod > Shadowlands, getting progressively worse every single time.

Why not make those currencies accountwide but spent per character, so that instead of having to choose between buying some catchup gear for other classes, and gearing the main character, you can do both?  Doesn't seem like it's a massive catchup mechanism anyway.  You could buy one piece of 135 gear - again, at the cost of progression on your main seemingly - while your main is 244.5?
snippet.textOriginal:
Don't... Don't call it a mission table.  You say that and all I see it those damn follower mission tables from Wod > Shadowlands, getting progressively worse every single time.

Why not make those currencies accountwide but spent per character, so that instead of having to choose between buying some catchup gear for other classes, and gearing the main character, you can do both?  Doesn't seem like it's a massive catchup mechanism anyway.  You could buy one piece of 135 gear - again, at the cost of progression on your main seemingly - while your main is 244.5?

snippet.textDisplay: so i watched this vid and got a bit intressted to test it out, Done 10 hours now and must say it feels good to play. Nothing amazing really but nothing really bad either. progress seems fine and the stepup from contenders and adept is huge when having low ilvl. Nothing feels slow, progress is steady in the beginning and its fairly easy to get a understanding of the class and rotation. I wouldnt main this game but i think its worth 22 euro to try it out for sure

snippet.textDisplay: It has nice ideas WOW should copy. But to be fair I dont think the hype will last. The gameplay is pretty easy and shallow, though fun at the beginning. But I dont see a lot of people playing this for very long, if they cant push out new content VERY regularly. To me its a casual version of m+ with many QoL features I wish would be in WOW. But thats about it. Also the characters so far are generic and pretty boring, I have seen this a THOUSAND times at this point. I'd wish for more creativity in that department.

snippet.textDisplay: Yeeeeaaaaaa. No. Dungeon farming/m+ sucks. Best parts about wow was classic thru wotlk. It was an epic feeling when you got down gearing and you could do other things in wow and feel op. Now retail essentially has zero cap on item level with updates and xpacs coming too fast too keep up with the 85 unique currencies, and this fellowship is literally just dungeon running with zero character customization. I think people will jump all over it for a month, and then it’ll be a niche following. No shame in that, but I think there is a ton of copium on this game

snippet.textDisplay:
Did they start development in 2004? This game graphically looks awful. 
I'm not going to waste my money on this. A game with only dungeons will die out insanely fast. "Progress your character", you don't have a character. It's like saying Darius or Teemo is your character in league. You are just selecting a template and can swap instantly between them all. 
I will be interested to see how many of these streamers jump ship once they aren't being sponsored to make videos / stream it.

Did they start development in 2004? This game graphically looks awful.

I will be interested to see how many of these streamers jump ship once they aren't being sponsored to make videos / stream it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Definitely agree that a lot of the gameplay stuff like kiss/curse and the kick trackers would be very welcome in other games. But I think it’s disingenuous to compare the progression and itemization system to something like M+ because this game is stand alone and can be built entirely around the dungeon grinding process. M+ has to take into account raid and now delves as other ways to gear and make sure that they all feel fair in relationship to each other. 

Of course a game that is designed entirely around one niche gameplay is going to excel at that compared to a game that has multiple niches to design for and make work together. Not saying things like M+ can’t learn from fellowship, but it’s not a 1 to 1 comparison, so you doing so feels disingenuous or uninformed.
snippet.textOriginal:
Definitely agree that a lot of the gameplay stuff like kiss/curse and the kick trackers would be very welcome in other games. But I think it’s disingenuous to compare the progression and itemization system to something like M+ because this game is stand alone and can be built entirely around the dungeon grinding process. M+ has to take into account raid and now delves as other ways to gear and make sure that they all feel fair in relationship to each other. 

Of course a game that is designed entirely around one niche gameplay is going to excel at that compared to a game that has multiple niches to design for and make work together. Not saying things like M+ can’t learn from fellowship, but it’s not a 1 to 1 comparison, so you doing so feels disingenuous or uninformed.

snippet.textDisplay:
Shame about the sorry state of the servers. Near impossible to get a game as DPS even after the first few patches.

EDIT: for those saying "that's normal as DPS" - I am having the exact same problem today trying to play healer. Their queues are busted, by their own admittance, and have been since open beta about a month ago. Packet loss, stuttering, neverending queues, being loaded into empty dungeons, you name it. Servers have been migrated last night to try and curb the issues.

snippet.textDisplay:
I definitively don't like Mythic+ and I have to say, I really liked the Fellowship beta.  Shocking to me, but I realized I don't like any of the stuff leading up to it.  

I can't really make an "incorrect" build decision, I don't have to prove via some external measure (achievement, mod, website) how good I am, the game already knows how good I am and places me with similar players.

And it's fast.  Like, I don't need to spend 30-40 minutes from when I log on to when I click a treasure chest.  Research, pots, build guides, refresh auctions.  None of that, just log and play.  It's fixes so much of the M+ gameplay loop
snippet.textOriginal:
I definitively don't like Mythic+ and I have to say, I really liked the Fellowship beta.  Shocking to me, but I realized I don't like any of the stuff leading up to it.  

I can't really make an "incorrect" build decision, I don't have to prove via some external measure (achievement, mod, website) how good I am, the game already knows how good I am and places me with similar players.

And it's fast.  Like, I don't need to spend 30-40 minutes from when I log on to when I click a treasure chest.  Research, pots, build guides, refresh auctions.  None of that, just log and play.  It's fixes so much of the M+ gameplay loop

snippet.textDisplay: Can someone make a game that’s the complete opposite of this? A big open world with leveling, adventure and quests/conflicts that involves NO dungeons are boss fights? This is why I don’t play any MMOs now.
snippet.textOriginal: Can someone make a game that’s the complete opposite of this? A big open world with leveling, adventure and quests/conflicts that involves NO dungeons are boss fights? This is why I don’t play any MMOs now.

snippet.textDisplay: Might give it a go!
